intro: Ixora ooumuensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian ixora, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its clusters of bright red or orange flowers, which bloom throughout the year in warm climates. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a glossy appearance. Ixora ooumuensis is typically found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
